items.name: Quick Start
items.template:
## Quick Start

```bash
git clone https://github.com/[USER]/[REPO].git
cd [REPO]
npm install
npm start
```

That's it! Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser.

items.name: NPM Installation
items.template:
## Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/[USER]/[REPO].git

# Navigate to directory
cd [REPO]

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev
```

items.name: Yarn Installation
items.template:
## Installation

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/[USER]/[REPO].git

# Navigate to directory  
cd [REPO]

# Install dependencies
yarn install

# Start development server
yarn dev
```

items.name: Docker Installation
items.template:
## Docker Installation

### Using Docker

```bash
# Build the image
docker build -t [REPO] .

# Run the container
docker run -p 3000:3000 [REPO]
```

### Using Docker Compose

```bash
# Start all services
docker-compose up -d

# View logs
docker-compose logs -f

# Stop services
docker-compose down
```

items.name: Prerequisites
items.template:
## Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

- **Node.js** (v18 or higher) - [Download](https://nodejs.org/)
- **npm** or **yarn** - Package manager
- **Git** - [Download](https://git-scm.com/)

Optional:
- **Docker** - For containerized deployment
- **VS Code** - Recommended editor

items.name: Usage Example
CLI Usage
items.template:
## Usage

### Command Line

```bash
# Basic usage
[REPO] <input>

# With options
[REPO] --option value input.txt

# Show help
[REPO] --help
```

### Options

| Flag | Description | Default |
|------|-------------|---------|
| `-o, --output` | Output file path | stdout |
| `-v, --verbose` | Enable verbose output | false |
| `-h, --help` | Show help | - |

items.name: Running Tests
items.template:
## Running Tests

```bash
# Run all tests
npm test

# Run tests with coverage
npm run test:coverage

# Run tests in watch mode
npm run test:watch

# Run specific test file
npm test -- path/to/test.js
```

items.name: Build & Deploy
items.template:
## Build & Deploy

### Build for Production

```bash
# Create production build
npm run build

# Preview production build
npm run preview
```

### Deployment

**Vercel:**
```bash
npx vercel
```

**Netlify:**
```bash
npx netlify deploy --prod
```

**GitHub Pages:**
```bash
npm run deploy
```
